@Hydralisk__ @kms_d4k @dim0kq Also, while I have no idea if the #Starlink terminals use some sort of frequency-hopping system or what their transmit/receive duty cycle is,

… the same characteristics that make a transmission resilient to atmospheric and man-made interference likely makes it harder to track.

subs.text: @jim_enloe @ArmchairG3neral @OSpurdo @WarObserver14 @kms_d4k @dim0kq The one they were testing in early 2021 (with terminal p/n 00105950-501): Ku-band antenna (012987-501) Tx gain: 34.2 dBi Beamwidth: 3.5deg. (HPBW) Tx power: 3.2 W Tx ERP: 5.1 kW Tx EIRP: 39.1 dBW 14.125 & 14.375 GHz antenna patterns: [link]
subs.rawText:
@jim_enloe @ArmchairG3neral @OSpurdo @WarObserver14 @kms_d4k @dim0kq The one they were testing in early 2021 (with terminal p/n 00105950-501):

Ku-band antenna (012987-501)
 Tx gain: 34.2 dBi
 Beamwidth: 3.5deg. (HPBW)

 Tx power: 3.2 W
 Tx ERP: 5.1 kW
 Tx EIRP: 39.1 dBW

14.125 & 14.375 GHz antenna patterns:

https://t.co/AXP5PGj1z6

subs.text: June 6

@Debkrol @aurabogado Agreed - you were clear.

(I just wanted to emphasize to folks that there was still a significant period of time with little-to-no ventilation.)
subs.rawText:
@Debkrol @aurabogado Agreed - you were clear.

(I just wanted to emphasize to folks that there was still a significant period of time with little-to-no ventilation.)

subs.text:
@Debkrol @aurabogado Risk:

Terminal > in seat while engines running

… but …

Boarding / unboarding > terminal > in seat while engines running

[_If_ shore ventilation is hooked up (those flexible yellow hoses from the JetWay) it’s still less effective than that provided by the engine bleed air.]
subs.rawText:
@Debkrol @aurabogado Risk:

Terminal > in seat while engines running

… but …

Boarding / unboarding > terminal > in seat while engines running

[_If_ shore ventilation is hooked up (those flexible yellow hoses from the JetWay) it’s still less effective than that provided by the engine bleed air.]

subs.text: June 4

@QuinnyPig Don’t all major orgs now have software that can pre-vet any URLs inside e-mails?

I get that a ‘allow-list over deny-list’ philosophy can be more work (and piss off e-mail #marketing/#tracking companies), but maybe now is the time to give it serious thought.
subs.rawText:
